duties_responsibilities.duty: Proactive management of meetings, commitments, and communication, including calendar, email, scheduling internal & external meetings, conference calls, and appointments.
Assist with planning and execution of meetings and events, including managing logistics, coordinating agendas, taking meeting notes, and following up on action items.
Proactively manage all travel arrangements, including air, hotel & ground transportation, visa assistance, and detailed itineraries.
Manage calendars strategically, maximizing usage of time and anticipating potential schedule conflicts.
Assist in managing day-to-day office functions, responding to emails, and attending meetings on behalf of the CEO if needed.
Proactively take on new tasks or projects without instruction and assume responsibility for key outcomes and deliverables.
Effectively manage interruptions of workflow with courtesy and flexibility while working through confidential information.
Ad Hoc Office Management work, such as ordering supplies and groceries.
Completion of some personal tasks related to work duties, such as booking dog boarding when the CEO is on work travel.
Work closely with our COO and Chief of Staff and perform EA duties as able for them.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Communication, or related field
